data.title: Switching UI/Syntax theme does not display all elements in the new correct color
data.body:
Repro steps from @damieng https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9550#issuecomment-322591908 

1. Install atom-ide-ui package
2. Open the diagnostics pane
3. Switch from One Light to One Dark or vice-versa
4. Observe wrong color for table column header

Actual part of the css is

```css
.nuclide-ui-table-header {
  font-weight: bold;
  background-color: @pane-item-background-color;
  border-bottom: 1px solid @base-border-color;
}
```

Where `@pane-item-background-color` is still resolving to the old value.

---

### UI theme

This can especially be seen when switching from white to black themes or reverse:
![themeswitching](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/11130908/f63e6bf8-8987-11e5-9162-00a59b8124d8.PNG)
![themeswitching2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/11131319/70b2a4ec-898a-11e5-94ce-19dd86b7d37b.PNG)

When restarting Atom the theme is correctly applied. However at least one package also often ignores a restart and show the wrong colour. This is:
- editor-stats as reported [here](https://github.com/atom/editor-stats/issues/28) already previously where this issue only was about this single addon

And FYI when switching back to the theme you switched from everything is displayed normally (or as before you switched - `editor-stats` still looks like it looked always)

This is similar to the issue https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8860 which was fixed before, but Atom does not show any warnings in the developer console.
### Syntax theme

I can also see this happening with the sytax theme. However here it only applies to `markdown-preview` (same issues as above; works when restarting Atom) and the editor seems to be changed correctly.
However when looking more carefully even here sometimes it does also not correctly change the font colour of a file (reproduced with a markdown file). When switching to a dark syntax theme the text stays grew. In this case also the global font setting is not applied correctly and does not change the font (note that it was correctly applied to a file opened after changing the theme).

One time it also did not changed the colour of the line numbers:
![linenumbers](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/11131689/2eeb2c6c-898c-11e5-9bf6-56956492bb67.PNG)

Atom 1.1.0
Windows 7

data.title: Scrolling through document is sluggish
data.body: Hi, I just upgraded to Atom v1.1.0 and have noticed an issue with scrolling. When I have a large file open (at least a few hundred lines) and scroll with the trackpad, the scroll is sluggish depending on how slowly I scroll. If I scroll slowly, it's very sluggish, however if I scroll at a faster rate, the speed increases exponentially. This makes it very difficult to navigate a large document by scrolling through it. I'm running on OS X 10.11.

data.title: copy/paste in native inputs no longer works
data.body:
Hi,

Nuclide debugger uses chrome debugger UI as it front end UI. Atom seems to hijack the copy/paste operations which caused these operations to be disabled in Nuclide watch/console window. 

I think it is regressed in recent Atom releases per user reporting. 

Any idea how to fix this?

Jeffrey

data.title: Uncaught error write: Epipe
data.body: Trying to use Atom with Clang auto-complete... but it doesn't seem to run properly, this error message appears when any key is pressed. clang-3.5 is installed

data.title: Atom is slow regaining focus on Windows and Linux with git repo
data.body:
Atom has a delay of ~1 second to respond to input when re-focusing. Seems to only affect Atom when a project folder is in a git repository.

Steps to reproduce:
Open Atom
Add a directory to your project that is a git repository or a subfolder of a git repository.
Open a file or create a new document in the same Atom session.
Switch to a different application.
Click back on Atom and wait for your input to be accepted.

When you click back on Atom there is a delay of 1~1.5 seconds before your action is performed (tab switch if you clicked a tab, cursor to start blinking if you clicked in the text of a document).

I ran the profiler during the task switching and I got the following data (rename the file to .json if necessary):
[TimelineRawData-20151112T091728.txt](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/32999/TimelineRawData-20151112T091728.txt)

I am able to solve the issue only by removing the git folder from my project.

I'm not versed in reading the profiling data but it looks like a call to `git-repository.js` is taking a lot of time up when the re-focus happens.

data.title: Atom does not autocomplete non-ASCII characters
data.body:
1. Edit a markdown file.
2. Write "versión" in a line.
3. Write "ver" in the next line.
4. Atom will show completion for "versi", not "versión".

data.title: On OSX Atom freezes after editing any file that needs sudo permission.
data.body:
On OSX after editing for example `/etc/hosts` and saving the file. Straight after system asks for your password to be able to overwrite the file Atom is freezing and need to be killed and started again

System OSX 10.11.1
Atom 1.1.0

data.title: Multiple Crashes / Freezes on Mac After 1.1 update
data.body: Since upgrading last week, my Atom has become increasingly unstable. I have tried to disable most of my packages, but the problems are continuing. The most common issue is it says the Editor has stopped responding, would you like to close. It also seems to use a lot of Memory. Any suggestions for how to identify the problem would be appreciated.

data.title: why doesn't atom ask to collect metrics?
data.body: It is my understanding the metrics package is installed and enabled by default.  Why doesn't Atom ever let people know and ask if this is ok or not?

data.title: Error "auto-updater is not implemented on this platform" on Linux
data.body:
I'm getting the following message in `~/.atom/nohup.out` or in the terminal when I start atom with the `--foreground` option. Atom seems to function properly, though. I use Atom v1.3.0-dev-62f4f32 on Debian 9.

```
$ cat ~/.atom/nohup.out 
auto-updater is not implemented on this platform
Error: auto-updater is not implemented on this platform
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/atom.asar/browser/api/lib/auto-updater.js:11:13)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/atom.asar/browser/api/lib/auto-updater.js:14:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:190:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at AutoUpdateManager.module.exports.AutoUpdateManager.setupAutoUpdater (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/browser/auto-update-manager.js:51:23)
    at /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/browser/auto-update-manager.js:42:24
App load time: 256ms
```

data.title: AtomEditor always opens on default display when X11 Forwarding
data.body:
Steps to dupe:
- Install Atom on Linux (1.1.0)
- Enable X11 Forwarding on your SSH server
- SSH to your "host" (ssh -X host.blah.blah.blah) from a "remote laptop"
- While ssh'd into your "host" type `atom` in the terminal.
- Watch SSH open on the "host's" default/physical display.
- (expected X11 Session to open on "remote laptop")

data.title: TreeView doesn't display nested git repos
data.body:
The scenario is this, I have a git repo in a directory named 'TreeViewBug', inside the root folder I created a new directory named 'nestedRepo' I added it to my .gitignore file, I also initialized the nestedRepo as a git repository of it's own.

``` shell
treeViewBug santo$ ll
total 16
drwxr-xr-x  13 santo  staff   442B Nov 11 15:33 .git/
drwxr-xr-x   6 santo  staff   204B Nov 11 15:22 ./
drwxr-xr-x   4 santo  staff   136B Nov 11 15:21 nestedRepo/
-rw-r--r--   1 santo  staff    11B Nov 11 15:20 .gitignore
drwxr-xr-x  55 santo  staff   1.8K Nov 11 15:20 ../
-rw-r--r--   1 santo  staff    15B Nov 11 15:19 file.txt
replicant:treeViewBug santo$ ll nestedRepo/
total 8
drwxr-xr-x   6 santo  staff   204B Nov 11 15:22 ../
drwxr-xr-x  13 santo  staff   442B Nov 11 15:22 .git/
drwxr-xr-x   4 santo  staff   136B Nov 11 15:21 ./
-rw-r--r--   1 santo  staff    23B Nov 11 15:21 nestedFile.txt
```

As expected the tree view in atom doesn't display my ignored directories, that being nestedRepo, Then I added (cmd+shift+o) the nestedRepo directory to my project folders,

Expected behavior: the nestedRepo appears in the treeview with all the files

Actual behavior: The nested repo directory appears but shows no files under it.

screenshot:

![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 3 34 30 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/120338/11103829/8a5974bc-888a-11e5-9c23-52dc55a63931.png)

data.title: Cursor disappears and unable to select text on Mac after using arrow keys.
data.body:
The cursor disappears and causes you to have to do a CMD-ALT-Control-L to reset the editor to get it back when you are at the start of a line and use the left arrow on your keyboard to jump to the end of the previous line. 

I have a Macbook Pro - Late 2011 with El Capitan installed. 
Atom version 1.1.0

data.title: Unexpected folding behavior
data.body:
If I follow these steps:
1. Fold Level 2
2. Open a single fold in code
3. Fold Level 3

I would expect that only the visible code to be folded at level 3. Currently Atom opens all folds and folds all code at level 3. This annoys me when I need to go through big files.

_Note: Sublime Text behaves as I'd expect_

data.title: Use fat arrow when showing errors in CommandInstaller
data.body:
Fixes #9525 

/cc: @izuzak @atom/feedback

data.title: Remap pane:show-item-9 to activate last pane item
data.body:
Activate the last tab on pane on cmd / ctrl + 9 shortcut.

Closes #6609.

Noticed work for this was started on #8557 but never finished. This adds the functionality and accompanying spec.

data.title: Lierdakil: Defer Activation Hooks
data.body:
- Fixes #8692 
- Fixes #8313

This PR fixes merge conflicts for #8692. #8692 fixes a bug with the following scenario:
- Open a file (e.g. `sample.js`)
- Close Atom
- Open Atom (observing that `sample.js` is open)
- A package with an activationHook of `language-javascript:grammar-used` is not activated

LGTM on the original PR.

data.title: Files don't open in initial window on OS X
data.body:
I am using Atom 1.2.0-beta2 on OS X 10.10. I open files like that:

```
open -a "Atom Beta" foo.js
```

If Atom isn't running yet then `foo.js` will be opened in the initial window. Opening another file after that will create a second application window, additional files will be added as tabs to that window. I would expect these files to be added to the initial window.

Originally I thought that the initial window is opened in dev mode because Cmd+Alt+I shortcut works there. However, `node-inspector` shows `window.devMode === false` for the initial window and `window.devMode === undefined` for the second one.

data.title: Introduce Config::transactAsync
data.body:
Refs: #9508 

This method is supposed to wrap asynchronous code within a `Config` transaction. It accepts a `callback` which must return a `Promise`: when this resolves or gets rejected (or the `callback` throws an error) we complete the transaction.

I am not super happy with the name I've chosen for this API, as it would have probably been better to follow Node's conventions (i.e. rename `::transact` to `::transactSync` and name the new one `::transact`): unfortunately that method name was already taken and it's part of the public API.

Another thought was to include this feature right inside the existing `::transact` method: although possible, the resulting method would need to conform to two different contracts based on the return type of `callback`, which feels somewhat misleading for clients. In the end having a separate method felt somewhat cleaner.

Feedback super welcome! :bow:  

/cc: @nathansobo @joshaber @atom/feedback

data.title: Activate core packages before activating third party packages
data.body:
In package activation, `linter-*` is activated **before** `notifications` package. Which results in https://github.com/steelbrain/package-deps/issues/25
I have to work it around by waiting 20 ms before getting the view of the notification, see [this line](https://github.com/steelbrain/package-deps/pull/26/files#diff-2ee7035f560888fa5c0f1c0e929032fdR21)

It would be nice to have this issue resolved in the core instead of working it around in every package.

data.title: Syntax highlighting stops working on long strings w/out a newline
data.body:
This seems to be dependent on how many different things there are to highlight in a line. Another user (askielboe) found a relatively brief example, written in LaTeX:
`$\a \a \a 0 \a^\a{a} \a^\a{a} \a^\a{a} \a^\a{a} $ $\a \a \a \a \a 0 \a $ $\a\a $ $^{a} \a 0$ $^{a}$ this text should not be colored`

I've also noted the bug in other languages.
